intro: Exacum axillare var. pentamera, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of small, brightly colored blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. Its foliage consists of velvety, dark green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of cultivation indoors.
